title: Methanex Price Target Cut to C$52.00 by Analysts at TD Securities (MX)
content:
Methanex (TSE:MX) had its target price trimmed by TD Securities from C$57.00 to C$52.00 in a research report sent to investors on Tuesday morning, Market Beat Ratings reports. The firm currently has a buy rating on the stock. 
 
Methanex ( TSE:MX ) opened at 47.93 on Tuesday. The firm has a market capitalization of $4.33 billion and a PE ratio of 16.01. Methanex has a 1-year low of $46.19 and a 1-year high of $77.70. The company’s 50-day moving average is $53.51 and its 200 day moving average is $63.98. 
 
In other news, Director Phillip Henry Cook bought 3,000 shares of the company’s stock in a transaction dated Monday, August 24th. The stock was bought at an average price of C$39.85 per share, with a total value of C$119,538.00. 
 
Separately, CIBC decreased their target price on shares of Methanex from C$59.00 to C$55.00 and set a sector perform rating for the company in a research note on Thursday, July 16th. 
 
Methanex Corporation is a Canada-based producer and supplier of methanol to international markets in Asia Pacific, North America, Europe and South America. The Company operates three production facilities in New Zealand, which supply methanol primarily to customers in Asia Pacific. Its two plants in Trinidad, Titan and Atlas, supply methanol markets in North America, Europe, Asia Pacific and South America. Its Geismar 1 facility in Louisiana supplies to customers in the United States. The Company through a joint venture facility in Egypt, located on the Mediterranean Sea, supplies methanol markets in Europe and Asia Pacific. Its plant in Medicine Hat, Alberta, supplies methanol to customers in North America. The Punta Arenas production complex in southern Chile supplies to customers in South America.
